New Records: Warriors made 19 3-pointers at a 41.3% clip compared to just seven made threes and 16.7% from three for Memphis.
Key Match Events: Buddy Hield led all scorers with 18 points and four 3-pointers.
Draymond Green set his previous career-high (39.5%) with 3-for-7 from deep against the Grizzlies.
Stephen Curry made a game-clinching fadeaway shot with 1.1 seconds remaining in the first half.
Buddy Hield hit a 28-foot three-pointer to extend the Warrior lead to 15 in the third quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: Draymond Green was ejected with 1:14 to play in the 4th quarter (two technical fouls).
The Warriors improved to 4-1 in clutch games this season (score within five points under five minutes).
The Warriors won their fifth-straight home game vs. the Grizzlies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors had six players in double figures, paced by Buddy Hield's 18 points and four 3-pointers in their 123-118 victory over the Memphis Grizzlies at Chase Center on Friday.
Lindy Waters III started in place of injured guard De'Anthony Melton and scored the Warriors' first five points.
Brandin Podziemski had a productive all-around game with nine points, seven rebounds and five assists.
The Warriors' bench scored 67 points, marking the fifth time this season tallying 60-plus points.
The Warriors improved to 4-1 when scoring 120-plus points.
The Warriors improved to 6-0 when grabbing 50-or-more rebounds.
Others: The Warriors are now 8-1 vs. teams from the Western Conference.
The Warriors have now started 10-2 or better six times since the 2014-15 season.
Golden State's reserves lead the NBA in scoring at 58.8 points per game.
